website_summaries.verdict: Great training ball with construction that reduces the bounce and rebounds.
pros: Soft lacrosse ball construction that makes it easier for beginners to learn to play
Contains the same weight and size as standard lacrosse balls but with a soft outer shell
Offered in more than a dozen color combinations that look great
cons: Not designed for actual game play

customer_reviews.title: If you're a parent sick of chasing after errant lacrosse balls...
customer_reviews.text: If you're a parent sick of chasing after errant lacrosse balls...this is for you. My son's throwing and catching has greatly improved since purchasing the Swax Lax training ball. I now spend less time, hunting for lacrosse balls in the bushes, over the garage, across the street in the neighbor's back yard, or half a mile down the street, and more time throwing and catching. As a layman, the size and weight of the Swax Lax seem pretty similar to a regular lacrosse ball. The advantage is when I miss, the ball doesn't take any crazy bounces into the thorniest bush in my yard, or roll two towns over.
customer_reviews.author: Jim A.

customer_reviews.title: Elevated our game with more touches
customer_reviews.text: This is a must for beginners, not scary and you don’t get as frustrated chasing the ball two towns away or under a thorny bush. Wish we had discoverd this earlier. Great for indoors or in the street. Don’t get me wrong this can still cause some damage but way more manageable than a real lacrosse ball. Better than the too light plastic practice balls. Bottom line this has increased our at home practice so I’m sure coach is happy. One con is the price for a glorified hacky sack.
customer_reviews.author: Lionel Man

customer_reviews.title: Gotta have to throw in the street or backyard.
customer_reviews.text: Very fun ball to throw with. All my sticks are strung with East Coast Mesh and find the ball does not stay in the pocket as a normal ball but this actually helps your skills. I mainly purchased so would not break any windows or ding cars in the street; my son and I have been throwing for 6 years and this gives me peace of mind over a regular ball. Awesome product
customer_reviews.author: William Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Train with my 6yo
customer_reviews.text: My 6yo boy has learned Lax with this ball. Its also great for playing catch by hand. Its a little pricey, but excellent quality and durability. I have about 4 of them, and we love them! perfect size/weight to match a real lax ball.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Cool product, love how it feels like a real ball.
customer_reviews.text: These things are great, when a real ball will bounce and get lost /bounce into bystanders. (When you dont have a lot of space/ or just being lazy and dont want to run far after a bad catch/throw) Good for a front/ back yard throw around. Good weight, feels good in the pocket, throws more like a real ball. Much better than thoes lighter weight foam "practice" balls.
customer_reviews.author: Matt F.

customer_reviews.title: Great Ball
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has been learning how to play lacrosse. This ball has been great. It greatly reduces the time she spends chasing after the ball. She is able to stay focused on stuck skills longer.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea DuVall

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this SWAX lacrosse training ball. If is great for practicing, since if the ball is missed it stops quickly and does not roll 450 feet away like an official lacrosse ball. It definitely has the same feel and weight as a normal lacrosse ball. I highly recommend this product. We also use it in between tournaments to avoid hitting people when warming up.
customer_reviews.author: VP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for indoor practices
customer_reviews.text: These LAX balls are wonderful especially for indoor workouts. The do not roll all around so my players do less time chasing the ball & more time working on the skill. They are the weight of an actual LAX ball so they are getting a good workout & practice during their drills. I will be purchasing more.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners, and goalie practice.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice lookin practice ball for a young Lax goalie/keeper. In hindsight I probably should have gotten one that didn’t blend in so well with the grass, but it’s really not that big of an issue. It’s well made and doesn’t feel like it is going to fall apart any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Work but too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Great concept. Works as advertised. But $11 for a single ball is too expensive. Would be cheaper to buy 5 regular balls for $2 each expect to loose them. How buy used ball for $1 each. I hate to use the term rip off but can’t justify the cost per ball.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Nice ball, feels good
customer_reviews.text: Great for my lax player to mess around with. Not sure how long it will last once the weather warms and she uses it hard. It seemed a bit over priced to me, but not out of line with other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlet Scholar

customer_reviews.title: Nice training tool
customer_reviews.text: Nice indoor training ball. It feels real in your stick. My son is a beginner and he has in his stick all the time walking around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Ballas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For LAX Training Kids
customer_reviews.text: This ball is genius (I wish I had thought of it)! Three outstanding features: durable; relatively soft and doesn’t travel 3 blocks on a missed catch/throw like a normal regulation lacrosse ball. I use it to help my 9 y/o be less afraid of being hit by a real lacrosse ball! Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Nice not having to chase balls down the street
customer_reviews.text: Don't bounce or roll as much as regulation balls. Kinda nice not having to chase them down the street for blocks.
customer_reviews.author: spetasal

customer_reviews.title: Good beginning
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to learn lacrosse with my six year old with hopes that it would go better than softball when I hit her in the face on day one. I like the softness and the weight to get used to the idea of catching a ball that might hit her body.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette M

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the kids as they learned to play. Saved a lot of running after the ball :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So MUCH better for catch!!!
customer_reviews.text: Play Lacrosse catch with my GF.. Love it, but its sort of scary to use the real ball. Had a few close calls where the REAL lacrosse ball bounced off my stick and almost got me in the mouth... With a real Lacrosse ball and no protection this would of been very bad... The Training ball took away all that anxiety and it feels exactly the same!!! A must buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: They do what's advertised, but they're just too damn expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Too expensive. Seriously... $11 for ONE ball that is basically a hackey sack ball? You can chase one ball over and over for $11, or spend over $100 for 10 of them. It's more cost effective to buy a case of regulation balls.
customer_reviews.author: G.Dan

customer_reviews.title: this was a great ball to use to teach my kid how to ...
customer_reviews.text: though a little pricey, this was a great ball to use to teach my kid how to catch a lacrosse ball. hurts way less than a regular ball when it bonks you, plus it doesn't roll away when he misses it. also, having a ball that's the right weight is so important for catching and throwing. the lighter pink balls or using tennis balls just isn't the same.
customer_reviews.author: Early Adopter

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old is obsessed with lacrosse. I bought this so he could cradle the ball or play lightly indoors without breaking any windows 👍
customer_reviews.author: athina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect training ball.
customer_reviews.text: No bounce is what we needed and this is the perfect ball for training in a yard or smaller space. We weighed this with a regular lacrosse ball and they weighed almost exactly the same. Made well and sturdy. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: stpetewill

customer_reviews.title: A Real Good Time, fun for all.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for Backyard Game Time with my Grand Daughter. She 10 and I'm 67, yes I still LOVE this Game. She's not so afraid of the hard ball any long now she was able to practice more. Highly recommend it !

customer_reviews.title: These are fabulous
customer_reviews.text: I really love these and the colors are fab. Actually found them cheaper in store than with prime, but better variety of colors online

customer_reviews.title: Great balls for passing in street.
customer_reviews.text: Great balls to play catch with, especially in a street. A normal LAX ball would bounce and bounce down the road, bye bye balley. This ball will hit and roll much easier to keep under control. Weight and feel is not exactly the same as a real lacrosse ball but, pretty close.

customer_reviews.title: Great Lacrosse Training Ball

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool!

customer_reviews.title: Why not just buy a lacrosse ball?

customer_reviews.title: Wish it lasted longer
customer_reviews.text: Durability was not very good. The ball lasted maybe 2 weeks before it tore and we couldn't use it anymore. Rips at the seams and inside spills out.

customer_reviews.title: good ball but only received one ball

I ordered the orange balls a couple of months ago and it came with a pack of three. this time I ordered the digital camo, and only one ball arrived. kind of expensive for one ball. please tell the consumers that the price is for only one ball thanks

customer_reviews.title: Must have

customer_reviews.title: Will still smash your windows
customer_reviews.text: The ball isn’t soft. It’s hard as a rock with a tiny amount of cushion. Put it this way, it’d still smash anything it hits (windows, cars, houses, faces).... which defeats the main purpose of the ball.

product_meta.title: SWAX LAX Lacrosse Training Ball - Same Size & Weight as Regulation Lacrosse Ball but Soft - Indoor Outdoor Practice Ball with Less Bounce & Reduced Rebounds
feature_bullets: LESS FEAR IF HIT: Players and coaches love this patented soft practice lacrosse ball because it’s softer than a hard rubber lacrosse ball, but is the same size and weight as a regulation ball. Ball feels real in player’s stick
TIRED OF CHASING BALLS? Balls have less bounce and minimal rebounds, which make for a more productive lacrosse practice environment
NO MORE RICOCHETS: Balls are perfect for indoor training, easy to scoop off floor. They’re gentle on hardwood gym floors and don’t bounce off bleachers or walls
TRAINING IN SMALL SPACES? The Swax Lax practice ball is essential for training in gyms, at home, in small spaces, or fields, turf, or yards. Ball is suitable for rebounders but not wall ball

SWAX LAX is an Official Training Partner of US Lacrosse. This highly durable training ball is perfect for all levels of lacrosse players, including lacrosse goalies. Great team, coach, or holiday gift
